page.title: List of Star Trek: The Original Series episodes

rev.comment: This image use does not comply with [[WP:NFCC]] #10c and MUST be removed until it does. Thank you.
rev.diff:
Line 1: Line 1: â
[[Image:TOSopeninglogo.png|thumb|right|250px|''Star Trek'' title card (Seasons 1 and 2).]]Created by [[Gene Roddenberry]], the [[science fiction]] [[Television program|television series]] '''''[[Star Trek: The Original Series|Star Trek]]''''' (which eventually acquired the [[retronym]] ''Star Trek: The Original Series'') starred [[William Shatner]] as [[James T. Kirk|Captain Kirk]], [[Leonard Nimoy]] as Mr. [[Spock]], [[DeForest Kelley]] as [[Leonard McCoy|Dr. Leonard "Bones" McCoy]], and [[Star Trek: The Original Series#Cast|crew]] aboard the fictional [[United Federation of Planets|Federation]] [[USS Enterprise (NCC-1701)|starship ''Enterprise'']]. The series originally aired from September 1966 through June 1969 on [[NBC]].<ref name="tos_nbc">{{cite book|last = Okuda|first = Michael and Denise| title = The Star Trek Encyclopedia (3rd ed.)| publisher = [[Pocket Books]]| location = New York| year = 1999| pages = 463| isbn = 0-671-53609-5 }}</ref>
+
Created by [[Gene Roddenberry]], the [[science fiction]] [[Television program|television series]] '''''[[Star Trek: The Original Series|Star Trek]]''''' (which eventually acquired the [[retronym]] ''Star Trek: The Original Series'') starred [[William Shatner]] as [[James T. Kirk|Captain Kirk]], [[Leonard Nimoy]] as Mr. [[Spock]], [[DeForest Kelley]] as [[Leonard McCoy|Dr. Leonard "Bones" McCoy]], and [[Star Trek: The Original Series#Cast|crew]] aboard the fictional [[United Federation of Planets|Federation]] [[USS Enterprise (NCC-1701)|starship ''Enterprise'']]. The series originally aired from September 1966 through June 1969 on [[NBC]].<ref name="tos_nbc">{{cite book|last = Okuda|first = Michael and Denise| title = The Star Trek Encyclopedia (3rd ed.)| publisher = [[Pocket Books]]| location = New York| year = 1999| pages = 463| isbn = 0-671-53609-5 }}</ref>
This is the first television program in the [[Star Trek|''Star Trek'' franchise]], and comprises a total of 79 regular episodes over the show's three seasons, along with the show's original [[television pilot|pilot episode]], "[[The Cage (Star Trek: The Original Series)|The Cage]]". The episodes are listed in chronological order by original air date,<ref name="airdates">{{cite book|last = Trimble|first = Bjo| authorlink = Bjo Trimble| title = Star Trek Concordance| publisher = [[Ballantine Books]]| location = New York| year = 1976| pages = 37â89| isbn = 0-345-25137-7-695 }}</ref> which match the episode order in each season's original,<ref name="s1_dvd">{{cite web|url=http://www.tvshowsondvd.com/releases/Star-Trek-Season-1/3771|title=Star Trek: Season 1 DVD Information|publisher=TVShowsOnDVD.com|accessdate=2009-04-30}}</ref><ref name="s2_dvd">{{cite web|url=http://www.tvshowsondvd.com/releases/Star-Trek-Season-2/3820|title=Star Trek: Season 2 DVD Information|publisher=TVShowsOnDVD.com|accessdate=2009-04-30}}</ref><ref name="s3_dvd">{{cite web|url=http://www.tvshowsondvd.com/releases/Star-Trek-Season-3/3821|title=Star Trek: Season 3 DVD Information|publisher=TVShowsOnDVD.com|accessdate=2009-04-30}}</ref> remastered,<ref name="s1_rem">{{cite web|url=http://www.tvshowsondvd.com/releases/Star-Trek-Season-1-Remastered-HD-DVD/6973|title=Star Trek: Season 1 (Remastered) DVD Information|publisher=TVShowsOnDVD.com|accessdate=2009-04-30}}</ref><ref name="s2_rem">{{cite web|url=http://www.tvshowsondvd.com/releases/Star-Trek-Season-2-Remastered/7736|title=Star Trek: Season 2 (Remastered) DVD Information|publisher=TVShowsOnDVD.com|accessdate=2009-04-30}}</ref><ref name="s3_rem">{{cite web|url=http://www.tvshowsondvd.com/releases/Star-Trek-Season-3-Remastered/8147|title=Star Trek: Season 3 (Remastered) DVD Information|publisher=TVShowsOnDVD.com|accessdate=2009-04-30}}</ref> and [[Blu-ray Disc|Blu-ray]] DVD<ref name="bluray">{{cite web|url=http://trekmovie.com/2009/02/16/cbs-paramount-announce-first-star-trek-blu-ray-sets-tos-s1-all-tos-movies-coming-aprilmay/|title=CBS & Paramount Announce First Star Trek Blu-ray sets - TOS S1 & All TOS movies coming April/May|publisher=TrekMovie.com|date=2009-02-16|accessdate=2009-04-28}}</ref> box sets. The original, single-disc DVD releases placed the episodes by production order, with "The Cage" on the final disc.<ref name="indv_dvd">{{cite web|url=http://www.tvshowsondvd.com/shows/Star-Trek/3971|title=Star Trek on DVD, Release Info, Reviews, News at TVShowsOnDVD.com|publisher=TVShowsOnDVD.com|accessdate=2009-04-30}}</ref> This list also includes the [[stardate]] on which the events of each episode took place within the fictional ''Star Trek'' universe.<ref name="stardates">{{cite book|last = Trimble|first = Bjo| authorlink = Bjo Trimble| title = Star Trek Concordance| publisher = [[Ballantine Books]]| location = New York| year = 1976| pages = 12â13| isbn = 0-345-25137-7-695 }}</ref>
This is the first television program in the [[Star Trek|''Star Trek'' franchise]], and comprises a total of 79 regular episodes over the show's three seasons, along with the show's original [[television pilot|pilot episode]], "[[The Cage (Star Trek: The Original Series)|The Cage]]". The episodes are listed in chronological order by original air date,<ref name="airdates">{{cite book|last = Trimble|first = Bjo| authorlink = Bjo Trimble| title = Star Trek Concordance| publisher = [[Ballantine Books]]| location = New York| year = 1976| pages = 37â89| isbn = 0-345-25137-7-695 }}</ref> which match the episode order in each season's original,<ref name="s1_dvd">{{cite web|url=http://www.tvshowsondvd.com/releases/Star-Trek-Season-1/3771|title=Star Trek: Season 1 DVD Information|publisher=TVShowsOnDVD.com|accessdate=2009-04-30}}</ref><ref name="s2_dvd">{{cite web|url=http://www.tvshowsondvd.com/releases/Star-Trek-Season-2/3820|title=Star Trek: Season 2 DVD Information|publisher=TVShowsOnDVD.com|accessdate=2009-04-30}}</ref><ref name="s3_dvd">{{cite web|url=http://www.tvshowsondvd.com/releases/Star-Trek-Season-3/3821|title=Star Trek: Season 3 DVD Information|publisher=TVShowsOnDVD.com|accessdate=2009-04-30}}</ref> remastered,<ref name="s1_rem">{{cite web|url=http://www.tvshowsondvd.com/releases/Star-Trek-Season-1-Remastered-HD-DVD/6973|title=Star Trek: Season 1 (Remastered) DVD Information|publisher=TVShowsOnDVD.com|accessdate=2009-04-30}}</ref><ref name="s2_rem">{{cite web|url=http://www.tvshowsondvd.com/releases/Star-Trek-Season-2-Remastered/7736|title=Star Trek: Season 2 (Remastered) DVD Information|publisher=TVShowsOnDVD.com|accessdate=2009-04-30}}</ref><ref name="s3_rem">{{cite web|url=http://www.tvshowsondvd.com/releases/Star-Trek-Season-3-Remastered/8147|title=Star Trek: Season 3 (Remastered) DVD Information|publisher=TVShowsOnDVD.com|accessdate=2009-04-30}}</ref> and [[Blu-ray Disc|Blu-ray]] DVD<ref name="bluray">{{cite web|url=http://trekmovie.com/2009/02/16/cbs-paramount-announce-first-star-trek-blu-ray-sets-tos-s1-all-tos-movies-coming-aprilmay/|title=CBS & Paramount Announce First Star Trek Blu-ray sets - TOS S1 & All TOS movies coming April/May|publisher=TrekMovie.com|date=2009-02-16|accessdate=2009-04-28}}</ref> box sets. The original, single-disc DVD releases placed the episodes by production order, with "The Cage" on the final disc.<ref name="indv_dvd">{{cite web|url=http://www.tvshowsondvd.com/shows/Star-Trek/3971|title=Star Trek on DVD, Release Info, Reviews, News at TVShowsOnDVD.com|publisher=TVShowsOnDVD.com|accessdate=2009-04-30}}</ref> This list also includes the [[stardate]] on which the events of each episode took place within the fictional ''Star Trek'' universe.<ref name="stardates">{{cite book|last = Trimble|first = Bjo| authorlink = Bjo Trimble| title = Star Trek Concordance| publisher = [[Ballantine Books]]| location = New York| year = 1976| pages = 12â13| isbn = 0-345-25137-7-695 }}</ref>
